duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide direct nursing care to patients undergoing electrophysiologic procedures.
Assist with preparation, operation, and termination of procedural equipment specific to diagnostic and interventional EP procedures.
Monitor patients' overall condition throughout procedures and provide emergency measures as necessary.
Administer medication and IV sedation under the direction of the physician.
Perform pacemaker, ICD, and CRT evaluations including thresholds, programming, and interpretation of diagnostics.
Comply with and adhere to radiation safety standards and practice.
Serve as on-call and late nurse on a rotating basis to cover late cases and emergency procedures.
Assist with the measurement of lead-electrode parameters, pulse generator output, and monitoring of the electrocardiogram during lead insertion.
Operate all device manufacturer programmers for pacemakers, ICDs, and CRT devices, and identify emergency back-up pacing and stat shocks on all programmers.
Recognize the impact of programming and troubleshoot malfunctions.
Comply with and be aware of radiation safety standards and practice.
